channel.title: I try to run my server and
channel.description:
I get this error:
[code]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 16 at ItemHandler.loadItemList(ItemHandler.Java:312) at ItemHandler.(init)(ItemHandler.java:39) at server.main(server.java:29) Epicarrowscape is now online![/code]
All I recently did was change item prices, and add in some "!!! NON-EXISTING ITEM ID: xxxxx!!!" to the item.cfg.
Any help?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 21, 2009, 10:35:51 am[/size][hr]I tried removing all the items that I recently added so it wouldn't say non-existing, blah, but it didn't fix anything... Sadly
Is it something to do with the shops? I can simply remove the items from there...

item.description:
@G0dz_Tank wrote:

[quote=“Epic Ancient, post:18, topic:296657”]Strangely enough, it didn’t fix it ._.

I searched all " " in item.cfg, itemhandler, and shops.cfg, fixed them all (all that needed to be…) and it still gives me this damned error. -.-"

Have the same fucking problem man except i was adding stat bonuses not shop prices :\

I copied (ctrl + c) my entire item.cfg. I deleted, saved, and then tried to run, and miracles come true: It works!
So, Ik the problem lies in item.cfg (I did paste it back in…), but now I gotta figure out what’s wrong with it. :s[/quote]

item.source: I try to run my server and

item.title: I try to run my server and
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

Not a problem, just modified the loading process of the item list, so print out the item IDs, that way when it gives you the exception, you know what item it is.

import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
import java.io.FileReader;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.PrintStream;


public class Find {
	
	

	public static ItemList ItemList[] = new ItemList[10000];

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		Find find = new Find();
		find.loadItemList("item.cfg");
	}

	private PrintStream misc = System.out;
	
	public boolean loadItemList(String FileName) {
		String line = "";
		String token = "";
		String token2 = "";
		String token2_2 = "";
		String[] token3 = new String[10];
		boolean EndOfFile = false;
		BufferedReader characterfile = null;
		try {
			characterfile = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(FileName));
		} catch (FileNotFoundException fileex) {
			misc .println(FileName + ": file not found.");
			return false;
		}
		try {
			line = characterfile.readLine();
		} catch (IOException ioexception) {
			System.out.println("Error File");
			return false;
		}
		while ((EndOfFile == false) && (line != null)) {
			line = line.trim();
			int spot = line.indexOf("=");
			if (spot > -1) {
				token = line.substring(0, spot);
				token = token.trim();
				token2 = line.substring(spot + 1);
				token2 = token2.trim();
				token2_2 = token2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token3 = token2_2.split("\t");
				if (token.equals("item")) {
					int[] Bonuses = new int[12];
					for (int i = 0; i < 12; i++) {
						misc.println(Integer.parseInt(token3[0]));
						if (token3[(6 + i)] != null) {
							Bonuses[i] = Integer.parseInt(token3[(6 + i)]);
						} else {
							break;
						}
					}
					newItemList(Integer.parseInt(token3[0]), token3[1]
							.replaceAll("_", " "), token3[2].replaceAll("_",
							" "), Double.parseDouble(token3[4]), Double
							.parseDouble(token3[4]), Double
							.parseDouble(token3[6]), Bonuses);
				}
			} else {
				if (line.equals("[ENDOFITEMLIST]")) {
					try {
						characterfile.close();
					} catch (IOException ioexception) {
					}
					return true;
				}
			}
			try {
				line = characterfile.readLine();
			} catch (IOException ioexception1) {
				EndOfFile = true;
			}
		}
		try {
			characterfile.close();
		} catch (IOException ioexception) {
		}
		return false;
	}
	
	public void newItemList(int ItemId, String ItemName,
			String ItemDescription, double ShopValue, double LowAlch,
			double HighAlch, int Bonuses[]) {
		// first, search for a free slot
		int slot = -1;
		for (int i = 0; i < 9999; i++) {
			if (ItemList[i] == null) {
				slot = i;
				break;
			}
		}

		if (slot == -1)
			return; // no free slot found
		ItemName = ItemName.replace("'", "");
		ItemDescription = ItemDescription.replace("'", "");
		ItemList newItemList = new ItemList(ItemId);
		newItemList.itemName = ItemName;
		newItemList.itemDescription = ItemDescription;
		newItemList.ShopValue = ShopValue;
		newItemList.LowAlch = LowAlch;
		newItemList.HighAlch = HighAlch;
		newItemList.Bonuses = Bonuses;
		ItemList[slot] = newItemList;
	}
	
}

Read full topic

item.title: I try to run my server and
item.dc:creator: @kingofnone kingofnone
item.description:
@kingofnone wrote:

[quote=“Epic Ancient, post:29, topic:296657”][quote author=kingofnone link=topic=392642.msg2927036#msg2927036 date=1251069495]
future reference mr. epic ancient… always have backup files and update them everytime you make a major update that is successful so if you ever do fuck up! you can just copy and paste and try again
[/quote]
Mr? Ima girl. ^^"
Also, why would you update backup files, it would just have the same problem occur. XD
Unless you checked. But who does that anymore…[/quote]

my bad=]
miss. or are you married…??? epic ancient what i mean by updating your backup after you have made a successful update is… do not update them until you have compiled and ran your server and made sure everything is good and then pretty much duplicate the whole server(after you have gotten it to a running/working state) and if you ever fuck up on your next project all you have to do is copy and paste your backup files and bada bing you now have a working server and you can try again!!!

ma’am
